titleStmt.title: Letter from H. E. Thompson to Eartha M. M. White. July 16, 1930.
titleStmt.author: Mrs. H. E. Thompson

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author writes to White to learn where to adopt an orhpan boy.

objectDesc.p: A handwritten letter from Mrs. H. E. Thompson to Eartha M. M. White on 7/16/1930. The letter is accompanied by its torn envelope, addressed to White of Jacksonville with no street address.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

div.p:
Can you give me any information
where I can find a colored boy
that needs a home? I would rather
have an orphan for I would know
that he was worthy, but any good,
rugged, strong boy 12-14 years of
age would answer, that I would
teach our way, and give a good
home until he was of age. I want
one that can save me steps and
do errands about the place, and
be generally useful, and for such
a home is offered. I shall return home
to FlaFlorida, in OctOctober, and could stop as I
go through JaxJacksonville, & see you if you could
locate one for me, or write me of some
one needing a place.
